intro: Mattia lanata var. detonsa, commonly known as the woolly mat plant, is a variant of the species Mattia lanata, characterized by its dense, woolly foliage. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features soft, white to grayish hairs covering its leaves, which give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. It is typically a low-growing shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. This plant is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative ground cover due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
